intro: Anthodiscus peruanus, commonly known as the Peruvian anthodiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for its attractive blooms.
